name: places/ChIJ44u7lL9YwokRK_QcrWCtvws
formattedAddress: 209 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 209 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text:
I like this place and my blowout has lasted several days. However it was really disappointing to wait 25 minutes after my appointment time, esp when they are not flexible the other way around. TIP: Know when you want your time and show up, the rescheduling and cancellation is not great.

I went in telling my woman about the photo shoot I was having and told her more about my personality and the impression I wanted to make and she made the suggestions based on her experience and my hair. I went in with my hair already washed so my service was fast and all got out on time.  Treat yourself, enjoy!

originalText.text:
Really disappointed with my experience. I have been coming to this salon to get my hair done for special occasions since I was in high school and never had any issue.

Almost 10 years later, I scheduled two appointments: one for Xmas Eve and another for NYE. The lady took a couple minutes to wash my very thick hair. She then blowed it out and I could still feel my wet roots. She curled it. When I got home, I found a huge gulp of shampoo sitting on my bed and I had to immediately wash my hair before Xmas Eve.

Going here is not worth your time. I can do a better job myself. I will be canceling my NYE appt immediately.

Going here is not worth your time. I can do a better job myself. I will be canceling my NYE appt immediately.

originalText.text: I asked for brushed curls 90s style as I always do. Unfortunately my blow out was handled by an unexperienced stylist… even though her manager tried to fix it, it is now puffy and looks like what I could have done at home with a revlon brush, and I’m not a pro. I am used to come to this location once per month and usually my hair would look amazing for days!! But this time, it was a waste of money (70$) :( please train your stylists and dont let them experiment on thick long hair… she wasn’t sectioning the hair in small or medium parts. I had a special event i needed to go too, cant believe i ended up doing my hair alone.

originalText.text: The person didn’t know about hair up do! Took more than a hour to do it just for ponytail was really bad for $125  is better to go to a hairstylist never come back Dry bar is not good any more place is gone

originalText.text:
Went into this location, the one on 56st and the one in SoHo THREE LOCATIONS in person requesting a call back from a Manager with a simple but important request regarding my bosses membership. Each person I dealt with looks like it was too much of an effort to provide any assistance whatsoever!! I left my request and phone number in writing THREE TIMES and as of today 10/33 no call from a Mgr. This place started out so strong and has gone downhill rapidly. Yes they are able to do an average standard blow out. And take your money for memberships and anything else but if you need anything beyond that no one will get back to you.
Wondering how they stay in business with ZERO customer service! Maybe product sales because their customer service is non existent.
